item.title: What is rm -rf?
item.description: I use a lot of Linux commands within my Ubuntu environment, and one of the most frequently used commands is rm -rf. I don’t even remember why I started using it. The only thing I can recall is that -r stands for recursive and -f stands for force. This is a pretty brutal command, as it deletes everything following the command without a blink of an eye. To be a more sophisticated engineer, I decide to break it down:
